message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public boolean isDistrict (String districtCheck){
    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(address,",");
    while(st.hasMoreTokens()){
        String district = st.nextToken();
        if(district.equals(districtCheck))
            return true;
    }
    return false;
}
<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer.nextToken() method is used to break a string into tokens. In your case, you are using it to break the address into different districts. The problem in your code is that you are using the '==' operator to compare strings, which checks if they are the same object, not if they have the same value. To compare the values of strings in Java, you should use the .equals() method. So, the corrected code checks each token (district) if it equals the districtCheck. If it finds a match, it returns true. If it goes through all the tokens and doesn't find a match, it returns false.
